crops.name: Wheat
crops.description: Wheat is a staple grain crop and is grown mainly in Rabi season.

crops.name: Rice
crops.description: Rice is the most widely consumed staple food for a large part of the world's human population.

crops.name: Maize
crops.description: Maize is a versatile crop used for food, fodder, and industrial purposes.

crops.name: Cotton
crops.description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll, or protective case.

crops.name: Potato
crops.description: Potatoes are a staple food crop, rich in carbohydrates and a key ingredient in many dishes.

pesticides.name: Neem Oil
pesticides.description: Neem oil is a natural pesticide used for a wide range of garden pests.

pesticides.name: Chlorpyrifos
pesticides.description: Chlorpyrifos is an organophosphate pesticide used to control various pests.

pesticides.name: Copper Sulfate
pesticides.description: Copper sulfate is used as a fungicide, herbicide, and pesticide.

fertilizers.name: Urea
fertilizers.description: Urea is a nitrogen-based fertilizer used widely to promote crop growth.

fertilizers.name: Potash
fertilizers.description: Potash is a key ingredient for improving plant health and crop yields.

fertilizers.name: DAP (Diammonium Phosphate)
fertilizers.description: DAP is a high-phosphorus fertilizer, essential for root development.

tools.name: Tractor
tools.description: A tractor is a powerful vehicle used for various farming tasks.

tools.name: Plow
tools.description: A plow is used for turning and loosening soil before planting.

tools.name: Seed Drill
tools.description: A seed drill is used for planting seeds at the correct depth and spacing.

tools.name: Sprayer
tools.description: A sprayer is used to apply pesticides, herbicides, or fertilizers.
